articles.author: Tom Murphy
articles.description: CELTIC are currently navigating a season filled with both challenges and opportunities. As the 2024-25 season progresses, the club finds itself dealing with significant injuries while also welcoming new signings that could prove pivotal in their quest for success. The injuries to Maik Nawrocki and Mikey Johnston have posed challenges, but the arrival of experienced [...]
articles.title: Celtic FC: Navigating Injuries and Embracing New Beginnings

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Kris Boyd’s post-match tirade on Sunday was arresting.  He was angry and, just after fulltime, his thoughts tumbled out in an unstructured manner.  You seldom see such vociferous anger on television outside of the drama genre.  I don’t recall ever seeing it from a sports presenter. Not long after getting home from such an emphatic [...]
articles.title: Uncontained post-match anger? Tune into on SkySports

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LUKE McCOWAN’S debut for Celtic was a lot more enjoyable than his previous appearance at Parkhead. On Sunday, the midfielder, bought for £1million from Dundee in a deadline-day switch, lived the dream when he was given the nod by Brendan Rodgers in the 76th minute to replace Reo Hatate. Callum McGregor had just thumped the [...]
articles.title: LUKE AND LEARN

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BACK in June, CQN named ten players who could be heading for the exit in Celtic’s summer clear-out. Nine out of the total have gone, but one performer remains. Puzzlingly, it’s Liam Shaw, a player who has made just ONE first-team appearance in over three years since arriving from Sheffield Wednesday in June 2021, a week before Ange Postecoglou took [...]
articles.title: CELTIC CLEAR-OUT: FORGOTTEN STAR IS ODD MAN OUT

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: I AM NOT privy to what goes on in the Celtic pre-match dressing room, but I would not be one bit surprised if Paulo Bernardo had been tipped the wink his game against Philippe Clement’s side on Sunday would be over around the hour mark. If all was going according to plan in the first [...]
articles.title: PROBLEM BHOY PAULO

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: RAMPANT Celtic scored three goals and could have added at least the same again as they pulverised Philippe Clement’s overwhelmed Ibrox side. Daizen Maeda and Kyogo Furuhashi netted twice in the opening half and skipper supreme Callum McGregor applied the finishing touches to a superb all-round performance when he pummelled No.3 behind a stunned Jack [...]
articles.title: WATCH AGAIN: A PUMMELLING IN PARADISE

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: “Every goal is a great goal”, as Tommy Gemmell memorably once told me, but some are greater than others.  This was never more evident than yesterday.  Kyogo is a penalty box finisher.  He comes alive between the posts, an area he can find space like no other in Scotland.  Like no other has been able [...]
articles.title: Calm, from a rare and precious talent

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS has enjoyed a record FIFTEEN victories in his 19 derby duels. It’s an extraordinary sequence that not even the legendary Jock Stein can match. The Celtic manager has also seen his side held on three occasions while suffering a solitary reverse. In his debut campaign at Parkhead, the Irishman guided the Hoops to ten triumphs over [...]
articles.title: RODGERS 15 RANGERS 1

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CALLUM McGREGOR led by example yet again as the Celtic captain guided his players through the derby minefield to a well-deserved 3-0 triumph over Philippe Clement’s stunned Ibrox side. The all-action Hoops onfield leader capped a wonderful display with a breathtaking left-foot drive that whizzed past the helpless Jack Butland for the champions’ final goal [...]
articles.title: BHOY OH BHOY: ‘FIRST CLASS,’ McGREGOR VERDICT ON RECRUITS

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: KASPER SCHMEICHEL made certain his unblemished Premiership record remained intact with two typical saves late in the game as Celtic cruised to a 3-0 triumph in the Glasgow derby. The points were as good as in the bag at a rocking Parkhead after Jack Butland, at the other end, had been invited to fish the ball [...]
articles.title: ‘ELECTRIC,’ RODGERS HAILS BACK-TO-FRONT CELTIC

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC 3 RANGERS 0 GLASGOW is smiles better with Celtic thrashing Philippe Clement’s Ibrox also-rans in convincing and ruthless fashion at Parkhead this afternoon. A first-half double from Daizen Maeda and Kyogo Furuhashi and an absolute screamer from Callum McGregor after the break saw the champions canter to three points. This was manager Brendan Rodgers’ [...]

Forrest, who claimed his century of goals for the club in style with a hat-trick [...]

Early this window, I was worried that Brendan would veer off plan and concentrate players [...]

Engels, who celebrates his 21st birthday next weekend, was all smiles after walking around the deserted stadium which will be a pulsating [...]
